name: Orange
goal:
Orange is one of the world’s leading telecommunications providers with 155,000 employees worldwide, including 96,000 employees in France, and sales over 40.9 billion euros for fiscal year 2016. The Group annually invested over 6.971 billion euros in infrastructure.

In 2016, Orange had a customer base of 263 million customers in 29 countries, including 202 million mobile customers and 18 million broadband internet ADSL, fibre) customers. Under the brand Orange Business Services, Orange is also a world leader in providing ICT services to multinational companies with local presence in over 160 countries and territories.

The following network operators are part of Orange in member states of the European Union:
Orange SA (FR),
Orange Luxembourg (LU)
Orange Polska (PL)
Orange Romania (RO)
Orange Slovensko (SK)
Orange Spain (SP)
Orange Belgium (BE)

The Brussels Representation of Orange covers actions and developments in Europe related to electronic communications, ICT for competitiveness and sustainable development, innovation. Its mission is to maintain relationships with key EU players and policymakers, and to bring the Group expertise to European debates, initiatives and actions.
Orange's ambition is to contribute to the success of the Digital Agenda for Europe and to support Europe’s competitiveness in the global economy.

Orange involvement covers a wide range of topics, including: fixed and wireless broadband development and investment; R&D and innovation; broadband contents and services; e-applications (e-health, smart cities,etc) for daily life and business; ICT for sustainable development; corporate social responsibility (CSR) issues, diversity.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Customs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Home Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade
